page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO HINDHEAD
page.content: THE AREA WE STUDIED IS DOMINATED BY THE A3, LONDON TO PORTSMOUTH ROAD WHICH INTERSECTS WITH THE HASLEMERE TO FARNHAM ROAD, A287, AT THE HINDHEAD CROSS ROADS. TODAY IT IS THIS ROAD AND THE RELATIVELY FAST LINK IT PROVIDES TO LONDON AND THE SOUTH, AS WELL AS TO HEATHROW AIRPORT VIA THE M25, WHICH HAS ACCOUNTED FOR THE RAPID GROWTH AND POPULARITY OF THIS AREA, WHERE THE MAJORITY OF THE HOUSES ARE LESS THAN 2O YEARS OLD. THE RURAL LANDSCAPE, AN AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY AND RECREATION, CONSISTS OF A SANDSTONE RIDGE WHICH RISES TO 272 METRES AT ITS HIGHEST POINT - GIBBET HILL AND WHICH IS PART OF THE WEALDEN DOME. HOWEVER, THE SANDY SOILS ARE ACID AND INFERTILE AND SO LITTLE USED FOR AGRICULTURE.
